title: Chapati
description: A humble, unleavened flatbread that's a staple of Indian cuisine, perfect for scooping up your favorite curries.
steps: Mix whole wheat flour and salt in a bowl.
Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin rounds.
Heat a griddle or pan and cook the chapatis until they puff up and have brown spots.
Serve hot with your favorite curry.

title: Butter Naan
description: Soft, pillowy bread with a touch of buttery goodness, the perfect sidekick to your flavorful dishes.
steps: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add yogurt and butter to the dry ingredients and mix well.
Gradually add water to make a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into oval or round shapes.
Cook the naan on a hot griddle or tava until they puff up and turn golden brown.
Brush with melted butter and serve.

title: Phulka
description: Light and puffed, these whole wheat flatbreads are a wholesome choice for your everyday meals.
steps: Mix whole wheat flour and salt in a bowl.
Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin rounds.
Cook the phulkas on a hot griddle or tava until they puff up and have brown spots.
Serve hot with your favorite side dish.

title: Parotta
description: Flaky, layered, and irresistible, these South Indian delights are a true indulgence for your taste buds.
steps: Mix all-purpose flour, salt, and ghee in a bowl.
Gradually add water and knead into a soft and elastic dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them into thin discs.
Heat a griddle or tava and cook the parotas until they are golden brown and flaky.
Serve hot with your favorite curry or chutney.
